column4: lintux & agent: i agree most of the semi-auto tools jack up code; they are good for quick dirty jobs but if you're making any sort of larger web-site; i'd recommend hand-coding but you can use gui tools to help w/that. bluefish will allow ftp access etc... to ease the pain

uhm... if you are using ftp "live" on a production website then something is wrong... i have a webserver installed on my computer for testing the whole website and upload the finished product... doing it otherwise is... well... horrible
yes code can be correct but it is always said in programming that clean/documented code is MUCH easier to maintain

but even "quick and dirty" websites can be done much quicker by hand... i mean: look how quick i can write:
compared to open app -> wait to load -> select create table -> fill in everything -> ok ;)
